description.narrative: Center for Sustainable Development Studies' mission is to empower and support youth to build their capacity to affect long-term change in regards to development issues. CSDS will support youth groups, especially 2030 Youth Force in terms of project coordination and management; such as developing work plans, managing sources of funding, and co-organizing public events). 2030 Youth Force is considered one of potential and influential network for youth in Vietnam, where Oxfam and its partners can explore strategic directionsin working with youth, including (1) thematic areas/ social issues that link Oxfam#s organizational investment to interests of youth; (2) ways to actively engage youth in our programs, and inform future programing; (3) identify potential leading youth groups/ individuals to be allies in our influencing strategy, be local actors where Oxfam does not have official representation yet, and be potential leaders for social change in the future. In this project, in addition to facilitation of youth discussions and actions towards sustainable development, CSDS will also work with Oxfam to consolidate lessons learnt on meaningful youth participation, and sharewith interested organizations working with youth in Vietnam and in the region.

participating-org.narrative:
CSDS was established in 2009 as a legally registered local non-governmental, not-profit organization. CSDS aims to promote education for sutainable development through building the capacity of people and organizations to address development challenges in Vietnam.
We use education and training as the primary means of empowering individuals and organizations to pursue sustainable development.We also focus on volunteering, particularly youth volunteering, as this provides a context for learning and practice, and a resource for delivering our programmes and projects. We also work in partnership with donors, the CSOs and local communities.
CSDS has a strong focus on building capability, especially for youth-led CBOs. The organization#s strength is in education and training and its focus is on youth and volunteering. CSDS has substantial experience and a strong record of achievement in capacity building, mobilizing and training volunteers, community development projects and in successfully and effectively managing donor projects. In seeking to build capacity for sustainable development, CSDS is focusing efforts at empowering youth to understand, value and implement sustainable development practices. The focus on youth is critical to our approach # theyrepresent a large proportion of the population, they are receptive to change and new ways of doing things and they are committed to taking action now in order to improve living conditions in the future. Currently CSDS is facilitate the Youth Empowerment Network (YEN) which was established in 2014 with the aim tofacilitate cooperation among youth groups, along with provision of capacity building to enhance their social impact and effeciency.YEN has now 21 members and will expand to include more groups and cover wider geographical area.
The International Volunteer Exchange programme provides opportunities for intercultural learning, knowledge sharing and capacity building (based on the expertise andexperience that international volunteers can bring totheir assignments), as well contributions to community development projects.
CSDS is also responsive to local community needs, and undertakes projects that support and empower local disadvantaged communities. Currently, our local community developmentprojects focus on action against climate, strengthening livelihoods for rural women (through microfinance and capacity building), support and education for children (through English language programmes and school buildings) and employment support for disadvantaged youth. We engage a lot of youth and volunteers in the development and implementation of such projects in which they work closely with local communities with full respect and support

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
